body_html:
I'll list down pros and cons of the following scenario:

Merge the tutorials to docs and retire pytorch/tutorials

Pros:

  1. Tutorials and docs in one place
  2. You can still download the tutorials as notebooks. Example screenshot
  3. Eye candy; easy to read.
  4. Better indexing and better visibility in search engines
  5. Maintenance is much easier as the py files are diffable and ipynb files are not.
  6. Outputs of cells in documentation are updated automatically if you modify the py file.

Cons:

  1. Existing SEO because of backlinks to ipynb tutorials will be lost.
  2. Downloaded ipynb are not very long because I've broken up the tutorials into pieces. But this can be fixed if need be. I'm not sure if this is really a con.

body:
I'll list down pros and cons of the following scenario:

> Merge the tutorials to docs and retire pytorch/tutorials

Pros:
1. Tutorials and docs in one place
3. You can still download the tutorials as notebooks. [Example screenshot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9305875/23466349/d6e63dee-fec0-11e6-940b-82c81340cd7f.png)
2. Eye candy; easy to read.
3. Better indexing and better visibility in search engines
2. Maintenance is much easier as the py files are diffable and ipynb files are not.
3. Outputs of cells in documentation are updated automatically if you modify the py file.

Cons:
1. Existing SEO because of backlinks to ipynb tutorials will be lost. 
2. Downloaded ipynb are not very long because I've broken up the tutorials into pieces. But this can be fixed if need be. I'm not sure if this is really a con.
